intro: Garuga, commonly known as the African snowball, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of yellow flowers that appear in late winter. The plant has smooth, grayish bark and dark green, ovate leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Garuga is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
